result.execSummary:
The defendant Sakina M Waskow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sakina M Waskow is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sakina M Waskow was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of right to seek postconviction relief

Defendant Sakina M Waskow in court.  Attorney Mark A Leonard in court for Sakina M Waskow.  Attorney Will R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. Jt; plea ct 2. DISM cts 1, 3. 18 months probation. Argument. Statement by DE. DNA ordered.

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count # 1, 3  . 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT # 2  
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 18 months, cc to 20CM1573

CONDITIONS:

-Not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription
-No threats/acts of violence against: anyone

-Anger mgmt. treatment
-Provide DNA sample

-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent. Assessment to be completed by 11/1/2022

-Shall not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is alcohol
-Shall not live anywhere alcohol is present.

COURT COSTS:
Ct # 2
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-Days credit for time already served:  3 (6/5/22 - 6/7/22)
-Days credit if revoked: 3

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Copy of minutes emailed to DOC.

Becky K
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Pre-trial conference on August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Hadyn K. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

02:29 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Kara M Rolf.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
